page.title: 13LOCAL HISTORY.
page.content: In 71 A.D.the{Romans}came to York and built a fortress,city walls,Multiangular Tower,the road "Bostum" and perhaps a cemetery in Longfield Terrace.{Vikings}settled here.Eric the Red lived in Earlsborough Terrace, and features in the Egil Skallagrimsson Saga.St.Olave's Church was named after King Olaph of Norway.{In Medieval {times }people paid tolls to enter York.Traders had their "booths" outside the city walls,hence "Bostum" became "Bootham".Boats paid their tolls at Lendal Bridge.St.Mary's Abbey owned a stretch of the River Ouse for fishing.The Plague hit York.In 1549 Hob Moor was isolated:a plague stone with a shallow basin remains there.In{1848}Leeman Rd was fields;Hudson and Leeman brought the railway to York and changed the area.
